intro: Echium margaritaceum, commonly known as the "Sea Holly," is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple, globe-shaped flowers that resemble small glass balls, hence its common name. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in well-drained soils, often growing in coastal areas. It is part of the Boraginaceae family, known for its hairy stems and showy blooms. Echium margaritaceum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
